name: Bengal Tiger
description: The Bengal tiger is a population of the Panthera tigris tigris subspecies. It is one of the biggest wild cats alive today.

name: Spider Monkey
description: Spider monkeys are New World monkeys known for their long limbs and prehensile tails.
facts: Use tails as an extra limb
Can swing through trees at 35 mph

name: Jaguar
description: The jaguar is the largest cat species in the Americas and the third-largest in the world.
facts: Strongest bite of all big cats

name: Scarlet Macaw
description: The scarlet macaw is a large red, yellow, and blue South American parrot, a member of a large group of Neotropical parrots called macaws.

name: Green Anaconda
description: The green anaconda is the heaviest and one of the longest known snake species.

name: Red-Eyed Tree Frog
description: The red-eyed tree frog is an arboreal hylid native to Neotropical rainforests where it lives in trees and other vegetation.
facts: Sticky pads on toes help climbing

name: Asian Elephant
description: The Asian elephant is the largest living land animal in Asia.
facts: Can eat up to 300 pounds of food daily

name: Orangutan
description: Orangutans are great apes native to the rainforests of Indonesia and Malaysia.
facts: Build nests to sleep in trees
